intro: Mirabilis rotundifolia, commonly known as the Round-leaf Four-o'clock, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its rounded, waxy leaves and clusters of vibrant, four-petaled flowers that open in the late afternoon. The plant is part of the Nyctaginaceae family, known for its showy blooms and unique flowering behavior. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Mirabilis rotundifolia is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
